an9.61:1.2: What is the progressive cessation that the Buddha spoke of?”
an9.61:2.1: “First, take a mendicant who, quite secluded from sensual pleasures … enters and remains in the first absorption.
an9.61:2.2: To this extent the Buddha spoke of progressive cessation in a qualified sense. …
an9.61:3.1: Furthermore, take a mendicant who, going totally beyond the dimension of neither perception nor non-perception, enters and remains in the cessation of perception and feeling. And, having seen with wisdom, their defilements come to an end.
an9.61:3.2: To this extent the Buddha spoke of progressive cessation in a definitive sense.”
